intro: Xylopia rigidiflora, commonly known as the rigid-flowered xylopia, is a tropical plant belonging to the Annonaceae family. It is characterized by its woody structure and is native to regions in Central and South America. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, textured surface. Xylopia rigidiflora is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
